title: Police identify 17-year-old killed in Mt. Morris Township shooting
content:
MT. MORRIS TWP., MI -- Police have identified a 17-year-old man killed in a shooting Monday morning in Mt. Morris Township.
Mt. Morris Township Police Chief Terence Green identified the victim as Alerio Wilson.
Green said officers responded to 911 calls at about 9:15 a.m. on Monday, June 27 to Pierson Road and Pierson Place for reports of an altercation between two men. As police were headed to the call, more 911 calls came in for reports shots fired.
When police got to Mattis Auto Wash, 3466 Pierson Place, they found Wilson dead in the doorway.
A man and a woman are in police custody in connection to the shooting, Green said.
The altercation started in the Suffolk Court apartments about 100 yards from the car wash.
No further information was available at this time.
Amanda Emery is a police reporter for MLive-The Flint Journal. Contact her at aemery@mlive.com or 810-285-0792. Follow her on Twitter or Facebook.
